application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
description: First floor rear extension (following removal of existing rear roof), rear roof extension and installation of windows to the side roofslopes, installation of window to flank first floor (main house), replacement of front elevation windows (double glazed UPVC framed casement to timber framed double glazed casement) and replacement like for like timber entrance door
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings: Revised plans :- Drg no: 2111/4A - proposed ground floor plan, Drg no: 2111/5B - proposed first floor plan, Drg no: 2111/6B - proposed second floor plan, Drg no: 2111/7A - proposed elevations (rear and sides - main change is flat roof and parapet to rear single storey, Drg no: 2111/8  - frontage/parking plan, Drg no: 2111/9 - existing elevations (rear and sides), Drg no: 2111/10B - existing and proposed front elevation and Drg no: 2111/11A - existing and proposed roof plan (main change is flat roof and parapet to rear single storey section).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall be in accordance with approved plans and as per planning application.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Adopted Ealing Development Plan Document 2013 and National Planning Policy Framework 2019 - Section 12 Achieving well-designed places
| No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013 and National Planning Policy Framework 2019 - section 12 - Achieving well-designed places.
| No new openings to the extension hereby approved shall be incorporated without prior written confirmation from the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D1, D4 and of the London Plan 2021, policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 3.1(b) and 3.8 Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012

| The proposed roof lights to the main and proposed roof shall be a Conservation style roof lights, lie flush with the roof, contain only obscure glass, and only have top openings at a minimum of 1.7m from floor level, and remain in perpetuity and in accordance with the revised plans incorporating "conservation style" rooflights and provide for "conservation style" rooflight to roofspace which lie flush with the roof planv.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Adopted Ealing Development Plan Document 2013 and National Planning Policy Framework 2019 - Section 12 Achieving well-designed places and Hanger Hill (Haymills) Estate Conservation Area Management Plan 2008
| The flank, first floor window (facing no.11 Ashbourne Close) shall contain only obscure glass and only have top openings at a minimum of 1.7m from floor level and remain in perpetuity.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D1, D4 and of the London Plan 2021, policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 3.1(b) and 3.8 Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012
